metadata.title: Risk Legacy Base Rules
metadata.description: Official rules for Risk Legacy base game

overview.title: Game Overview
overview.summary: Risk Legacy is a legacy board game where 3-5 players compete for global domination across multiple games in a campaign.

objective.title: Game Objective
objective.content: Be the first player to earn 4 stars to win the game. Stars persist across the campaign, and the first player to reach 4 stars in any game wins immediately.

rules.text: First player to earn 4 stars wins immediately

components.title: Game Components
components.content: The game includes 5 factions, 42 territories across 6 continents, territory cards, mission cards, event cards, stickers, and various tokens.

rules.text: Risk Legacy is designed for 3-5 players

setup.title: Game Setup
setup.summary: How to prepare and start a game of Risk Legacy

turn_order.title: Determining Turn Order
turn_order.content: Turn order is determined by campaign star count. Players with fewer stars choose their faction first and take turns first, creating a catch-up mechanic.

rules.text: Players with fewer stars go first in turn order
In the first game, turn order is determined randomly

examples.scenario: Player A has 2 stars, Player B has 1 star, Player C has 3 stars
examples.explanation: Turn order is: Player B (1 star), Player A (2 stars), Player C (3 stars)

faction_selection.title: Faction Selection
faction_selection.content: Players choose factions in turn order. Once a faction is chosen, no other player can use it in that game.

rules.text: Players select factions in turn order (fewest stars first)
Each faction can only be chosen by one player per game
Within a campaign, each player should choose a different faction across all games

power_selection.title: Power Card Selection
power_selection.content: After choosing a faction, each player selects one of their faction's two starting power cards. This choice is permanent for the game.

rules.text: Each player chooses 1 of their faction's 2 starting power cards
Power choice is permanent for the duration of the game

initial_placement.title: Initial Troop Placement
initial_placement.content: Players take turns placing troops on the board until all starting troops are placed. Each player then places their HQ.

rules.text: Players place initial troops in turn order
Each player receives starting troops based on player count

hq_placement.title: HQ Placement
hq_placement.content: After initial troop placement, each player places their HQ in one of their controlled territories.

rules.text: Each player places their HQ in a controlled territory with no other HQ
Only one HQ can exist in a territory

turn_structure.title: Turn Structure
turn_structure.summary: The sequence of phases in each player's turn

phases.title: Turn Phases
phases.content: Each turn consists of four phases: Recruit, Attack, Maneuver, and Draw. All phases except Attack are optional.

rules.text: Turn phases occur in order: 1) Recruit, 2) Attack, 3) Maneuver, 4) Draw
The Recruit phase is mandatory
The Attack phase is optional
The Maneuver phase is optional
The Draw phase only occurs if at least 1 territory was conquered

recruit.title: Recruit Phase
recruit.summary: How to recruit and place troops at the start of your turn

calculation.title: Troop Calculation
calculation.content: Count your controlled territories plus population (cities), divide by 3, round down. Minimum 3 troops.

rules.text: Recruit troops = (territories + population) ÷ 3, rounded down
Minimum recruit is always 3 troops
Each city provides +1 population for recruitment calculation

examples.scenario: Player controls 10 territories with no cities

examples.explanation: Recruit = 2 ÷ 3 = 0.66, but minimum is 3, so recruit 3 troops

placement.title: Troop Placement
placement.content: Place recruited troops in any controlled territories in any distribution.

rules.text: Troops can only be placed in territories you control
Troops can be distributed across territories in any way

card_turnin.title: Card Turn-in
card_turnin.content: Instead of recruiting normally, you may turn in resource card sets for bonus troops.

rules.text: You may turn in card sets instead of normal recruitment
3 cards of the same territory = 4 troops
1 card from each of 3 different continents = 8 troops
3 or more cards with matching values = 4 × value troops

examples.explanation: Receive 4 troops to place in Alaska

examples.scenario: Turn in 1 North America card, 1 Europe card, 1 Asia card
Turn in 3 cards each with value 2

combat.title: Combat Rules
combat.summary: How to attack territories and resolve combat

attacking.title: Initiating an Attack
attacking.content: To attack, you must have at least 2 troops in the attacking territory and attack an adjacent enemy territory.

rules.text: You must have at least 2 troops in the attacking territory
You can only attack adjacent territories
You can only attack territories controlled by other players

dice_rolling.title: Rolling Dice
dice_rolling.content: Attacker rolls 1-3 dice based on attacking troops. Defender rolls 1-2 dice based on defending troops.

rules.text: Attacker rolls 1-3 dice based on attacking troops (max 3)
Defender rolls 1-2 dice based on defending troops (max 2)
Attacker rolls 1 die per troop, up to 3 dice maximum
Defender rolls 1 die per troop, up to 2 dice maximum

examples.scenario: Attacker has 5 troops, defender has 3 troops
examples.explanation: Attacker rolls 3 dice (max), defender rolls 2 dice (max)

examples.scenario: Attacker has 2 troops, defender has 1 troop
examples.explanation: Attacker rolls 1 die (must leave 1 troop), defender rolls 1 die

resolution.title: Combat Resolution
resolution.content: Compare highest dice. If both have 2+ dice, also compare second highest. Ties go to defender.

rules.text: Compare the highest die from each side
If both rolled 2+ dice, also compare the second highest dice
Ties go to the defender
Loser of each comparison removes 1 troop

examples.explanation: Compare 6 vs 5 (attacker wins), 4 vs 3 (attacker wins). Defender loses 2 troops.
Compare 5 vs 5 (tie, defender wins), 3 vs 2 (attacker wins). Each loses 1 troop.

fortification.title: Fortification Bonus
fortification.content: Fortified territories provide a defensive bonus in combat.

rules.text: Fortified territories add +1 to the defender's highest die
Territories with HQs are always fortified

conquest.title: Conquering Territory
conquest.content: When all defending troops are eliminated, the attacker conquers the territory.

rules.text: Territory is conquered when all defending troops are eliminated
Attacker must move at least as many troops as dice rolled into conquered territory
Conquering a territory with an HQ awards the attacker 1 star

missiles.title: Missile Usage
missiles.content: Missiles can be used once per game to modify a single die result in combat.

rules.text: Missiles can be used to modify a single die by ±1
Each missile can only be used once per game
Used missiles are placed on the board permanently

examples.scenario: Attacker rolls a 5 and uses a missile

special_conditions.title: Special Combat Conditions
special_conditions.content: Certain dice combinations trigger special effects.

rules.text: Natural 6s may trigger faction-specific effects
Three-of-a-kind may trigger faction-specific effects

maneuver.title: Maneuver Phase
maneuver.summary: How to move troops between your territories at the end of your turn

movement.title: Moving Troops
movement.content: Once per turn, you may move troops between connected friendly territories.

rules.text: You may maneuver once per turn
Troops can only move between connected friendly territories
You must leave at least 1 troop in the source territory
Maneuver occurs at the end of your turn, after combat

examples.scenario: You control Alaska (5 troops) and Alberta (2 troops), which are connected
examples.explanation: You can move up to 4 troops from Alaska to Alberta (must leave 1)

cards.title: Card System
cards.summary: Territory cards, coin cards, and how to use them

drawing.title: Drawing Cards
drawing.content: Draw cards at the end of your turn if you conquered at least one territory.

rules.text: Draw 1 territory card if you conquered at least 1 territory this turn
Draw 1 coin card if you conquered 4 or more territories this turn
Cards are drawn at the end of your turn

territory_cards.title: Territory Cards
territory_cards.content: Cards representing territories on the board with resource values.

rules.text: Territory cards start with a resource value of 1
Territory cards can be upgraded to a maximum value of 4

coin_cards.title: Coin Cards
coin_cards.content: Special cards that provide recruitment bonuses.

rules.text: There are 10 coin cards in the deck
Coin cards are used during recruitment for bonus troops

victory.title: Victory Conditions
victory.summary: How to earn stars and win the game

stars.title: Star Acquisition
stars.content: Stars are earned through various achievements and persist across the campaign.

rules.text: First player to earn 4 stars wins immediately
Conquering a territory with an HQ awards 1 star
Completing a mission card awards 1 star
Controlling territories with 10+ red stars awards 1 star at end of turn
Winning a game awards 1-2 stars based on stars already on the board
Stars persist across all games in a campaign

immediate_victory.title: Immediate Victory
immediate_victory.content: The game ends immediately when a player earns their 4th star.

rules.text: Game ends immediately when any player reaches 4 stars

hq.title: Headquarters (HQ)
hq.summary: Special HQ markers and their rules

properties.title: HQ Properties
properties.content: HQs provide combat bonuses and are worth stars when conquered.

rules.text: HQ counts as 1 troop for combat purposes
Territories with HQs are always fortified
Conquering an HQ awards the attacker 1 star

placement.title: HQ Placement and Movement
placement.content: Rules for where and when HQs can be placed.

rules.text: HQs are placed during initial setup in a controlled territory
HQs can be relocated to any controlled territory with no other HQ
When an HQ is conquered, it returns to the owning player to be placed again

cities.title: Cities
cities.summary: Minor cities and world capital mechanics

minor_cities.title: Minor Cities
minor_cities.content: Cities provide population bonuses for recruitment.

rules.text: Each minor city provides +1 population for recruitment calculation
There are 9 minor cities that can be founded
Cities are founded by placing city stickers on territories

world_capital.title: World Capital
world_capital.content: The special world capital city provides continent-wide bonuses.

rules.text: The world capital provides +1 to all resource cards in its continent
Only 1 world capital can be founded

general.title: Mission Mechanics
general.content: Missions are secret objectives that players work toward during the game.

rules.text: Mission cards are dealt at the start of the game and kept secret
Completing a mission awards 1 star
You may discard your mission once per game to draw a new one
You must claim mission completion to receive the star

territories.title: Territories and Continents
territories.summary: The game board and territory connections

continents.title: Continents
continents.content: The 42 territories are organized into 6 continents.

rules.text: North America contains 9 territories
South America contains 4 territories
Europe contains 7 territories
Africa contains 6 territories
Asia contains 12 territories
Australia contains 4 territories

adjacency.title: Territory Adjacency
adjacency.content: Territories are connected to adjacent territories for attack and maneuver purposes.

rules.text: You can only attack adjacent territories
You can only maneuver through connected friendly territories

red_stars.title: Red Star Territories
red_stars.content: Special territories marked with red stars for victory conditions.

rules.text: There are 10 territories marked with red stars on the board
Controlling 10+ red stars at end of turn awards 1 star

campaign.title: Campaign Persistence
campaign.content: Changes made during games persist across the entire campaign.

rules.text: Winners sign the board after each game
Stickers placed on the board are permanent
Scars added to factions persist across all future games

stickers.title: Sticker System
stickers.content: Various stickers permanently modify the game.

rules.text: City stickers found cities on territories
Resource value stickers increase territory card values
Territory name stickers allow renaming territories
Victory stickers provide bonuses to the winner's faction in that territory
Players add scars to factions at the end of each game
Scars apply negative effects to factions in future games
Each faction can only have one of each scar type

unlocks.title: Unlock Packs
unlocks.summary: New content unlocked during the campaign

conditions.title: Unlock Conditions
conditions.content: Packs open when specific conditions are met during the campaign.

rules.text: Second Win pack opens when someone signs the board for the 2nd time
World Capital pack opens when the world capital is founded
Minor Cities pack opens when all 9 minor cities are founded
Eliminated pack opens when a faction is eliminated from a game
Thirty Troops pack opens when a player places 30+ troops in one turn and has a missile
Three Missiles pack opens when 3 missiles are used on the same combat roll

content.title: Unlock Pack Contents
content.content: Each pack contains new powers, missions, events, rules, and stickers.

rules.text: Unlock packs add new faction powers
Unlock packs add new mission cards
Unlock packs add new event cards
Unlock packs can modify or add new game rules
Unlock packs add new sticker types

endgame.title: End Game Phase
endgame.summary: What happens when a player wins

winner_actions.title: Winner Actions
winner_actions.content: The winner performs special actions that permanently modify the game.

rules.text: Winner signs the board with their name and date
Winner places a victory sticker on a territory
Winner receives 1-2 stars based on stars already on the board

all_players.title: All Player Actions
all_players.content: All players can contribute to faction scars.

rules.text: All players can add scars to factions at game end

unlock_check.title: Unlock Conditions Check
unlock_check.content: Check if any unlock conditions were met during the game.

rules.text: Check all unlock conditions at the end of each game
Open any triggered unlock packs and integrate their contents

imperial_balkania.name: Imperial Balkania
imperial_balkania.description: Focus on recruitment and expansion bonuses

starting_powers.text: Round up when dividing territories by 3 during recruitment
Draw a coin card when expanding by 4+ territories without conquest

imperial_balkania.strategy_notes: Best for players who like building large armies and aggressive expansion

enclave_of_the_bear.name: Enclave of the Bear
enclave_of_the_bear.description: Focus on attack bonuses and combat advantages

starting_powers.text: Defender rolls -1 die on your first attack each turn (minimum 1 die)
Rolling three-of-a-kind automatically conquers the territory

enclave_of_the_bear.strategy_notes: Best for aggressive players who enjoy combat and conquering territories

khan_industries.name: Khan Industries
khan_industries.description: Focus on HQ bonuses and steady troop generation

starting_powers.text: Place 1 troop in your HQ territory at the start of your turn
Place 1 troop in your HQ territory when drawing a territory card

khan_industries.strategy_notes: Best for defensive players who like fortifying key positions

die_mechaniker.name: Die Mechaniker
die_mechaniker.description: Focus on defense and fortification bonuses

starting_powers.text: Your starting HQ territory is always fortified
Rolling double 6s allows you to place a fortification token on the territory

die_mechaniker.strategy_notes: Best for defensive players who like holding key territories

saharan_republic.name: Saharan Republic
saharan_republic.description: Focus on maneuver flexibility and mobility

starting_powers.text: You may maneuver at any time during your turn, not just at the end
You may maneuver troops between any of your territories, not just connected ones

saharan_republic.strategy_notes: Best for tactical players who like repositioning and strategic flexibility

glossary.definition: A special marker that counts as 1 troop, makes the territory fortified, and awards 1 star when conquered
A territory with a defensive bonus that adds +1 to the defender's highest die roll
Successfully defeating all troops in an enemy territory and taking control of it
Territory cards with resource values used for recruiting troops
Victory points that persist across games in a campaign. First to 4 stars wins.
A one-time use item that modifies a single combat die by ±1
A value provided by cities that increases troop recruitment
Markers on 10 territories. Controlling 10+ red stars awards 1 star at end of turn.
A permanent negative modification to a faction
A permanent modification placed on the board, cards, or faction sheets
A secret objective that awards 1 star when completed
A series of connected games where changes persist between games
New content opened when specific conditions are met during the campaign
A sticker placed on a territory that provides +1 population for recruitment
A special city that provides +1 to all resource cards in its continent
A special card drawn when conquering 4+ territories in a turn
Territories that share a border and can be attacked or maneuvered between
A path of friendly territories for maneuver purposes
